list.title: Deep
list.content:
1. Elevate the injured part 
2. Wash your hands with soap and clean water 
3. With a clean cloth, press directly on the wound (for about 20 mins) to stop bleeding 
4. Wash the skin around the wound with clean cool water 
5.Be careful to clean out any dirt in the wound using tweezers or clean cloth/gauze 
6. Place a piece of clean lightly on the cut 
7.Seek medical attention
list.cautions:
CAUTION 
Do not use a tourniquet, rope, or wire to stop the bleeding, Never use dirt, kerosene, lime, or coffee to stop bleeding, When bleeding or injury is severe, raise the feet and lower the head to prevent shock, Keep blood from getting into any cuts or sores on your skin.

list.title: Small
list.content: Then place a piece of clean gauze or cloth over the top. It should be light enough so that the air can get to the wound and help it to heal. Change the gauze or cloth every day and look for signs of infection (see p. 88). If you have a dirty wound or a puncture wound, and have never had a tetanus immunization
list.cautions: NEVER put alcohol, tincture of iodine, or Merthiolate directly into a wound; doing so will damage the flesh and make healing slower.

Bruises: 
(When blood vessels under the skin tear or rupture, most often from a bump or fall) 
1.      Ensure that the bruised area is well protected 
2.      Elevate above heart level if possible 
3.      Apply ice to reduce swelling 
4.      An elastic wrap around the bruised area will also reduce swelling 
5.      Gently massage the bruised area to relive pain 
6.      If the bruise is causing pain, take an over-the-counter pain reliever
list.cautions: Caution: The use of smoke or tobacco slows the healing of bruises.

list.title: Blisters
list.content:
Blisters: 
1. If the blisters are broken, wash gently with clean water 
2. If there is Vaseline, apply a bit on a sterile gauze and place it lightly over the burn 
3. Secure the sterile gauze with a tape 
4. Where there is no Vaseline, leave the burn uncovered 
5. Seek medical attention
list.cautions:
Caution: 
Do not smear grease, butter, fat, hides, herbs on a burn. Do not break the blisters/ put ice on the burn/ apply pressure on the wound

list.title: No Blisters
list.content:
1. Put the burned part in cool water 
2. Cover lightly  with a sterile, non-adhesive bandage or clean cloth 
3. Take an over-the-counter pain reliever for the pain
list.cautions:
Caution: 
Do not smear grease, butter, fat, hides, herbs on a burn. Do not break the blisters/ put ice on the burn/ apply pressure on the wound

list.title: Deep Burn
list.content:
Deep burns:  
1. In this type of burn, the skin is exposed, there is charred flesh and the burns usually cover large areas of the body. 
2. Wrap the burned part with very clean cloth(lintless) moistened with water 
3. Seek medical attention immediately 
Deep burns can cause shock. Prevent this by 
1. Reassuring the person 
2. Give the injured person an over-the-counter pain reliever 
3. Lay flat and elevate burned area if possible. 
4. In cases of facial burn, have the person sit up
list.cautions: Caution: Do not smear grease, fat, hides, herbs on a burn. Do not break the blisters/ put ice on the burn/ apply pressure on the wound.

list.title: Vaginal Tearing
list.content:
Vaginal tearing: Happens when the vagina is too dry during sex. It usually heals on its own but to prevent it, use lubricants before the act. If it keeps bleeding, seek medical attention. 
 Stuck condom: Happens when a condom is stuck in the vagina. The best course of action is to wait for 10 to 15 minutes after sex, then use two fingers to fish out the item. If you are unable to get it out, seek the services of a doctor.
list.cautions: Do not use any other thing apart from your fingers to try to get it out.

list.title: Carpet Burn
list.content:
Carpet burns: 
Happens when the knee or elbow is scrapped while having sex on the floor. 
1.    Wash infected area with cool water and antibacterial soap 
2.    Apply an anti-bacterial cream 
3.    Cover lightly with a bandage
list.cautions: Do not use any other thing apart from your fingers to try to get it out.

list.title: Pull Muscle
list.content:
Pulled muscles: 
Quite common and usually caused by endorphins released during sex. 
1.    Take an over-the-counter anti-inflammatory drug 
2.    Elevate the affected part if possible 
3.    Apply cold compress to reduce the swelling 
4.    Seek medical attention if condition does not improve after 2 days
list.cautions: Do not use any other thing apart from your fingers to try to get it out.

list.content:
STRAIN and SPRAIN 
(Abnormal stretching or tearing of a muscle is a strain, stretching or tearing of a ligament that supports a joint is a sprain) 
Most times it is impossible to detect whether an injury (especially on the hand or foot) is a sprain or a strain, in which case an x-ray helps. The RICE method helps in treatment of strains and sprains. 
1. Rest: Lie in  a comfortable position 
2. Ice: Wet clothes or ice packs should be placed over the injured part 
3. Comfortable support: Wrap the injured part firmly with an elastic bandage 
4. Elevate: Elevate the injured part and support with soft cushions 
5. Take an over-the-counter pain reliever 
6. Seek medical attention
list.cautions: Caution: Never rub or massage a sprain or broken bone.

list.content:
(Happens when a foreign object is lodged in the throat or windpipe blocking flow of air) 
1.    Stand behind the person and wrap your arms around the waist 
2.    Put your fist against the belly above the navel and below the ribs 
3.    Press into the belly with a sudden strong upward jerk 
4.    Repeat several times if necessary 
If the victim is way bigger than you are 
1.    Lay the person on the back 
2.    Tilt the  head to one side 
3.    Sit over the person with the heel of your lower hand on the belly between navel and ribs. 
    Make a quick, strong upward push 
5.    Repeat several times if necessary 
To dislodge a foreign item from your throat 
1.    Place a fist slightly above your navel 
2.    Grasp your fist with the other hand and bend over a hard surface. 
3.    Shove your fist inward and upward. 
4.    Repeat if necessary 
If the victim is unconscious 
1.    Lower the person on the back onto the floor 
2.    Clear the airway: If a blockage is visible at the back of the throat, reach a finger to pull it out. Be careful not to push it further back 
3.    Conduct Chest compressions and mouth-to-mouth breathing 
4.    Seek medical attention immediately

list.title: Diarrhea
list.content:
1. Take lots of liquids to avoid dehydration 
2. Liquid foods such as broth, or soft foods like mashed potato should be taken for energy 
3. Seek medical attention
list.cautions:
Caution: 
Do not eat or drink laxative or purge, fatty and greasy foods, alcoholic beverages or highly seasoned foods

list.title: Mammals
list.content:
BITES and STINGS 
Animal: 
1. Wash the wound from the bite thoroughly with soap and warm water to reduce risk of infection 
2. Raise and support the wound 
3. Dry it with clean gauze or cloth 
4. Cover lightly with a clean cloth/gauze 
5. If the wound is large or deep, apply direct pressure 
6. Secure firmly with a bandage 
7. Seek medical attention

list.title: Insects
list.content:
Insects:(Spiders, Scorpions, Bees, Wasps, Hornets) 
1. Scrape off the insect stinger sideways with a straight-edged object like a credit card 
2. Apply ice to the area to reduce swelling 
3. Elevate the affected area if possible 
4. If there are signs of allergic reaction, seek medical attention
